Description:
Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

Author: frack113, Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
Query: sourcetype='windows-sysmon' eql select * from _source_ where (((process_path like '%\powershell.exe' or process_path like '%\pwsh.exe') and (filepath like '%.bat' or filepath like '%.chm' or filepath like '%.cmd' or filepath like '%.com' or filepath like '%.dll' or filepath like '%.exe' or filepath like '%.hta' or filepath like '%.jar' or filepath like '%.js' or filepath like '%.ocx' or filepath like '%.scr' or filepath like '%.sys' or filepath like '%.vbe' or filepath like '%.vbs' or filepath like '%.wsf')) and  not ((filepath like 'c:\users\%' and filepath like '%\appdata\local\temp\%' and (filepath like '%.dll' or filepath like '%.exe')) or (filepath like 'c:\windows\temp\%' and (filepath like '%.dll' or filepath like '%.exe'))))
